ResourceHeader.ResourceName: OMTI Airglow Temperature Photometer (ATP) at Sata, Japan
ResourceHeader.Description: Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTIs) Airglow Temperature Photometer (ATP) Data. The ATP measures airglow rotational temperature and airglow intensity in the mesopause region at 80-100km altitudes through the OH and O2 airglow emission lines. It also measures airglow and auroral intensities at 557.7nm, 630nm, 589.3nm, 777.4nm, 427.8nm, and 486.1nm. For more information, see http://stdb2.isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp/omti/. Digital data are available upon request to PI. For details of the instrument, please take a look at Shiokawa, K., Y. Otsuka, S. Suzuki, T. Katoh, Y. Katoh, M. Satoh, T. Ogawa, H. Takahashi, D. Gobbi, T. Nakamura, B. P. Williams, C.-Y. She, M. Taguchi, and T. Shimomai, Development of airglow temperature photometers with cooled-CCD detectors, Earth Planets Space, 59, 585-599, 2007.
